item.text: (5:15) King Hiram of Tyre sent messengers to Solomon when he heard that he had been anointed king in his father’s place. (Hiram had always been an ally of David.)

<st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> then <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">this message</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="02438" class="">Hiram</st>:
“You know that my father David was unable to build a temple to honor the Lord his God, for he was busy fighting battles on all fronts while the Lord subdued his enemies.
But now the Lord my God has made me secure on all fronts; there is no adversary or dangerous threat.

So I have decided to build a temple to honor the Lord my God, as the Lord instructed my father David, ‘Your son, whom I will put on your throne in your place, is the one who will build a temple to honor me.’

So now order some cedars of Lebanon to be cut for me. My servants will work with your servants. I will pay your servants whatever you say is appropriate, for you know that we have no one among us who knows how to cut down trees like the Sidonians.”
When Hiram heard Solomon’s message, he was very happy. He said, “The Lord is worthy of praise today because he has given David a wise son to rule over this great nation.”

<st data-num="02438" class="">Hiram</st> then <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">this message</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st>: “I <st data-num="08085" class="">received</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="0834" class="">message</st> you <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> me. <st data-num="0589" class="">I</st> will <st data-num="06213" class="">give</st> you <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="06086 0730">cedars</st> and <st data-num="06086 01265">evergreens</st> you <st data-num="02656" class="">need</st>.<n id="2" />

My servants will bring the timber down from Lebanon to the sea. I will send it by sea in raft-like bundles to the place you designate. There I will separate the logs and you can carry them away. In exchange you will supply the food I need for my royal court.”
So Hiram supplied the cedars and evergreens Solomon needed,

and <st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> <st data-num="05414" class="">supplied</st> <st data-num="02438" class="">Hiram</st> <st data-num="03541 05414 08010 02438 08141 08141">annually</st> with <st data-num="06242 0505">20,000</st> <st data-num="03734" class="">cors</st> <n id="1" /> of <st data-num="02406" class="">wheat</st> as <st data-num="04361" class="">provision</st> for his <st data-num="01004" class="">royal court</st>,<n id="2" /> as well as <st data-num="06242 0505">120,000</st> <st data-num="01324" class="">gallons</st><n id="3" /> of <st data-num="03795" class="">pure</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="08081" class="">olive oil</st>.<n id="5" />
So the Lord gave Solomon wisdom, as he had promised him. And Hiram and Solomon were at peace and made a treaty.
King Solomon conscripted work crews from throughout Israel, 30,000 men in all.

He <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> them to <st data-num="03844" class="">Lebanon</st> in <st data-num="02487" class="">shifts</st> of <st data-num="06235 0505">10,000</st> men per <st data-num="02320" class="">month</st>. They <st data-num="01961" class="">worked</st> in <st data-num="03844" class="">Lebanon</st> for one <st data-num="02320" class="">month</st>, and then spent <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="02320" class="">months</st> at <st data-num="01004" class="">home</st>. <st data-num="0141" class="">Adoniram</st> was <st data-num="05921" class="">supervisor of</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="04522" class="">work crews</st>.

<st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> also <st data-num="01961" class="">had</st> <st data-num="07657 0505">70,000</st> <st data-num="05375 05449">common laborers</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="08084 0505">80,000</st> <st data-num="02672" class="">stonecutters</st><n id="2" /> in the <st data-num="02022" class="">hills</st>,

<st data-num="0905" class="">besides</st> <st data-num="07969 0505 03967">3,300</st> <st data-num="08269 05324 08010">officials</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> <st data-num="05921 04399 07287">supervised</st> the <st data-num="05971 06213 04399">workers</st>.<n id="2" />

By <st data-num="04428" class="">royal</st> <st data-num="06680" class="">order</st><n id="1" /> they <st data-num="05265" class="">supplied</st> <st data-num="068 01419">large</st> <st data-num="03368" class="">valuable</st> <st data-num="068" class="">stones</st> in order to <st data-num="03245" class="">build</st> the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple’s</st> <st data-num="03245" class="">foundation</st> with <st data-num="01496" class="">chiseled</st> <st data-num="068" class="">stone</st>.
Solomon’s and Hiram’s construction workers, along with men from Byblos, did the chiseling and prepared the wood and stones for the building of the temple.
